Name: Common
Description: The most widely spoken language in the world. Most human settlements speak Common, and it serves as a lingua franca for trade and diplomacy.

Name: Elvish
Description: The language of elves, known for its flowing, melodic sounds. Also called Elven.

Name: Dwarvish
Description: The language of dwarves, characterized by its guttural sounds and runic script. Also called Dwarven.

Name: Halfling
Description: The language of halflings, a simple and cheerful tongue.

Name: Gnomish
Description: The language of gnomes, known for its technical vocabulary and precise grammar.

Name: Orc
Description: The guttural language of orcs, used for communication among orc tribes.

Name: Draconic
Description: The language of dragons, one of the oldest languages in existence. Many scholars learn Draconic to study ancient texts.

Name: Infernal
Description: The language of devils, used in contracts and legal documents in the Nine Hells.

Name: Abyssal
Description: The language of demons, a chaotic and harsh tongue spoken in the Abyss.

Name: Celestial
Description: The language of celestials, used by angels and other divine beings.

Name: Deep Speech
Description: A language spoken by aberrations and other creatures from the Far Realm. It has no script.

Name: Giant
Description: The language of giants, used by various giant races.

Name: Goblin
Description: The language of goblins and hobgoblins.

Name: Primordial
Description: The ancient language of elementals, with four dialects: Aquan, Auran, Ignan, and Terran.

Name: Sylvan
Description: The language of fey creatures, spoken in the Feywild.

Name: Undercommon
Description: A trade language spoken in the Underdark, derived from Elvish and Dwarvish.
